title: Comparative Analysis of ABA Therapy Approaches for Children with Autism: Evaluating RT and TAU Effectiveness

context.prior_knowledge: Core principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) and understanding of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) intervention strategies
context.additional_context: Learners are practicing behavior analysts or professionals in related fields, requiring comparative studies based on actual clinical cases

learning_goals: They can explain the theoretical differences between Relational Training (RT) and Treatment as Usual (TAU).
They can interpret research findings comparing changes in children’s skill acquisition and intelligence scores when applying RT and TAU.
They can propose appropriate application strategies for RT and TAU when designing intervention programs for children with autism.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
